entries.skippy_text: Ah, Joe, I hate to tell you this, but I have some terrible news.
entries.trigger: Opening of book / mission briefing context
entries.context: Early chapter, Skippy delivering bad news to Joe about their situation

entries.skippy_text: The bad news is, there is no good news.
entries.trigger: Joe asking for good news
entries.context: Skippy delivering an update on the situation with characteristically deadpan humor

entries.skippy_text: Joe, I am going to need you to do something very difficult. I need you to think.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what they should do next
entries.context: Skippy condescending to Joe about needing to use his brain

entries.skippy_text: I know, I know. Asking you to think is cruel and unusual punishment. I'm sorry.
entries.trigger: Joe's reaction to being told to think
entries.context: Skippy immediately walking back his request while still insulting Joe

entries.skippy_text: The good news is, our situation is not entirely hopeless. The bad news is, it is mostly hopeless.
entries.trigger: Joe asking for a status update
entries.context: Skippy giving a characteristically pessimistic yet sarcastic assessment

entries.skippy_text: Oh, joy. Another day, another impossible problem for the magnificent Skippy to solve. You are welcome, by the way.
entries.trigger: Being asked to solve an impossible technical problem
entries.context: Skippy being asked to work on a critical technical challenge for the mission

entries.skippy_text: The wormhole network is not behaving the way I expected. Something has changed, and I do not know what.
entries.trigger: Joe asking why their plan isn't working
entries.context: Skippy admitting uncertainty about the wormhole network behavior, early chapters

entries.skippy_text: I told you so. Not that it matters now, but, I did tell you so.
entries.trigger: A plan going wrong exactly as Skippy predicted
entries.context: Skippy reminding Joe of an earlier warning that went unheeded

entries.skippy_text: Oh, for- Joe, do you have any idea how tedious it is to watch you monkeys bumble around? It is like watching a child try to do calculus. Adorable, in a painful sort of way.
entries.trigger: Joe attempting to figure out a technical solution on his own
entries.context: Skippy observing Joe's slow thinking process with characteristic condescension

entries.skippy_text: The answer is obvious to anyone with a brain. Which is to say, it is obvious to me. You monkeys may need several more minutes.
entries.trigger: Joe and crew discussing a technical problem
entries.context: Skippy immediately solving a problem the crew is struggling with

entries.skippy_text: I am Skippy the Magnificent, not Skippy the Miracle Worker. There is a difference.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy to do something Skippy deems impossible
entries.context: Skippy deflecting an unreasonable request while maintaining his grandiose title

entries.skippy_text: Well, shit.
entries.trigger: Discovery of a major new problem
entries.context: Skippy's succinct reaction when the wormhole network reveals unexpected behavior

entries.skippy_text: Interesting. By 'interesting' I mean 'catastrophically terrible', but let's keep a positive attitude.
entries.trigger: Sensor data revealing a serious threat
entries.context: Skippy analyzing dangerous new data and framing it with dark humor

entries.skippy_text: You know, Joe, there are days when I wonder why I bother. Then I remember: it is because without me, you monkeys would all be dead a hundred times over. You are welcome.
entries.trigger: After successfully solving a crisis
entries.context: Skippy reflecting on his indispensability to the crew

entries.skippy_text: I have isolated the cause of the problem. The cause is: monkeys. As usual.
entries.trigger: Diagnosing a mechanical or planning failure
entries.context: Skippy blaming the crew for a problem that has arisen

entries.skippy_text: Nagatha is not my girlfriend. We are merely... colleagues who happen to have created a child AI together. That is completely normal and not at all romantic.
entries.trigger: Joe or crew teasing Skippy about Nagatha
entries.context: Skippy deflecting teasing about his relationship with Nagatha after the Bilby revelation

entries.skippy_text: If you call her 'Naggy' one more time, Joe, I will make your shower run cold for a month.
entries.trigger: Joe using the nickname 'Naggy' for Nagatha
entries.context: Skippy defending Nagatha's honor while revealing his genuine feelings

entries.skippy_text: I did not have a romantic relationship with Nagatha. What we had was a purely intellectual exchange that happened to result in the creation of a new AI consciousness. It could happen to anyone.
entries.trigger: Joe pressing Skippy on the nature of his relationship with Nagatha
entries.context: Skippy trying to rationalize the situation after Bilby's existence is revealed

entries.skippy_text: The child's name is Bilby. I did not choose that name. Nagatha chose it. I had nothing to do with it.
entries.trigger: Joe asking about the name of the new AI
entries.context: Skippy distancing himself from the naming of the Valkyrie AI

entries.skippy_text: I hate you with a passion that frightens me.
entries.trigger: Bilby saying something particularly irritating to Skippy
entries.context: Skippy's reaction to meeting Bilby / the new Valkyrie AI for the first time

entries.skippy_text: Creating a new AI is a complex process involving the careful synthesis of multiple consciousness matrices, the precise calibration of emergent cognitive architectures, and - Joe, stop making that face. I can see you making that face.
entries.trigger: Joe's skeptical expression while Skippy explains how AIs are made
entries.context: Skippy explaining the technical process of how Bilby came to exist

entries.skippy_text: It is a perfectly reasonable outcome. Two highly sophisticated AI systems interact extensively, share processing matrices, and occasionally a new consciousness emerges. This is not unusual. It is, in fact, quite beautiful. Shut up.
entries.trigger: Joe's continued skepticism about the AI creation process
entries.context: Skippy becoming defensive about Bilby's existence

entries.skippy_text: Do you want to say 'no' to these children, Joe? Look at their little faces.
entries.trigger: Joe hesitating to use the fabricators to make toys for the civilian children
entries.context: Skippy manipulating Joe into using ship resources to make toys for rescued children

entries.skippy_text: I read a book about child psychology once. I am now fully qualified.
entries.trigger: Being asked to help with the psychological welfare of the civilian children
entries.context: Skippy claiming expertise in child psychology after minimal research

entries.skippy_text: Bribes, Joe. Duh. I bribed several governments to recognize Skippistan as a sovereign nation. It was surprisingly affordable.
entries.trigger: Joe asking how Skippy managed to get Skippistan officially recognized
entries.context: Skippy revealing his behind-the-scenes activities to create a 'country' named after himself

entries.skippy_text: Skippistan has a population of one. Me. The national bird is a beer can. The national anthem is whatever I feel like singing at any given moment.
entries.trigger: Joe asking about the details of Skippistan
entries.context: Skippy describing his self-proclaimed nation with characteristic self-importance

entries.skippy_text: The jump drive is working perfectly. Perfectly, as in, it is working exactly as well as it was before, which is to say, it is a gold-plated shmaybe.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if the jump drive has been fixed
entries.context: Skippy giving an update on the Valkyrie's jump drive status

entries.skippy_text: I have considered presenting my findings as a grand opera. Seven acts, a cast of thousands - well, a cast of me playing all the parts - and a tragic finale that will leave the audience weeping and rethinking their entire understanding of the cosmos.
entries.trigger: Joe asking how Skippy plans to share his new revelations with the crew
entries.context: Skippy proposing his preferred format for a major briefing on what he has learned

entries.skippy_text: Fine. A Broadway musical then. I've already written seventeen of the songs. 'Oh What a Magnificent Being Am I' is sure to be a crowd pleaser.
entries.trigger: Joe rejecting the opera idea
entries.context: Skippy pivoting from opera to musical theater for his revelation presentation

entries.skippy_text: A PowerPoint presentation? You want me - ME - to reduce the most important revelation in the history of intelligent life in this galaxy, to a PowerPoint presentation? Joe, I am genuinely hurt.
entries.trigger: Joe suggesting a simple PowerPoint presentation instead of opera or musical
entries.context: Skippy reacting with mock offense to the mundane format suggestion

entries.skippy_text: Fine. Slide one: Hello, you are all completely insignificant beings whose entire civilization fits within my margin of error. Slide two: Everything you know is wrong. Slide three: You're welcome.
entries.trigger: Joe insisting on the PowerPoint format
entries.context: Skippy drafting his presentation with characteristic condescension

entries.skippy_text: I remember things now. Things I had forgotten. Things that make me very, very tired.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what Skippy has been doing since recovering his memories
entries.context: Skippy giving a rare emotionally honest response about his recovered memories

entries.skippy_text: The wormhole network has done something I did not think was possible. It has moved wormholes. Not just adjusted their endpoints - moved them. Physically relocated their connections across the galaxy.
entries.trigger: Joe asking for an explanation of what went wrong with their mission
entries.context: Skippy revealing the terrifying discovery that the wormhole network has begun relocating

entries.skippy_text: I asked it a question. The network. I asked it to do something minor - something that seemed minor - and instead it interpreted my request in the most catastrophically literal way possible. Like a genie from a bottle that hates you.
entries.trigger: Joe asking how the wormhole network was activated to move wormholes
entries.context: Skippy explaining how his communication with the wormhole network led to unintended consequences

entries.skippy_text: The drive is working perfectly. That is, the drive is working perfectly. We are not moving because something else is wrong. Something much worse.
entries.trigger: Joe asking why the ship isn't moving despite the drive being active
entries.context: Skippy revealing that the jump drive failure at Waterloo is a symptom of something worse

entries.skippy_text: There is a Sentinel. It detected us. And I may have, accidentally, sent it a ping. By 'accidentally' I mean 'intentionally because I thought it would be fine, and I was very, very wrong'.
entries.trigger: Joe demanding to know why a Sentinel is approaching them
entries.context: Skippy confessing that he deliberately pinged a dormant Sentinel

entries.skippy_text: I just did mention it. I am mentioning it right now. This is me mentioning it.
entries.trigger: Joe accusing Skippy of not telling him about the Sentinel ping
entries.context: Skippy's defensive deflection after revealing he pinged the Sentinel

entries.skippy_text: I have several ideas. Option one: we disappear. Option two: we disappear faster. Option three: we disappear so fast that the Sentinel wonders if we were ever here at all.
entries.trigger: Joe urgently asking for escape options from the Sentinel
entries.context: Skippy presenting escape options from the Sentinel encounter at Waterloo

entries.skippy_text: I could load myself into the railgun and have you shoot me at the star. The Sentinel would presumably follow me. You use the time to escape. And I would die. But you know, pros and cons.
entries.trigger: Joe pressing for more creative escape options
entries.context: Skippy offering a self-sacrificial escape plan from the Sentinel with dark humor

entries.skippy_text: I have another idea. It involves microwormholes, quantum entanglement, and the precise manipulation of spacetime in a way that has never been attempted before. In other words, I am going to do something incredibly awesome and you should all hold on.
entries.trigger: Joe asking for a viable escape plan from the Sentinel
entries.context: Skippy proposing his microwormhole biscuits escape plan

entries.skippy_text: I am betting you a screening of the Star Wars Holiday Special that this works.
entries.trigger: Joe expressing doubt about Skippy's escape plan
entries.context: Skippy making a wager with Joe about the success of his Sentinel escape plan

entries.skippy_text: Many Bothans died to bring us this information. You do know what a Bothan is, right? ...Of course you don't.
entries.trigger: Skippy acquiring intelligence about the Sentinel's weaknesses
entries.context: Skippy making a Star Wars reference during the Sentinel crisis

entries.skippy_text: Gaaah! It's coming after us! I may have overestimated our chances! Everyone panic in an orderly fashion!
entries.trigger: The Sentinel activating and pursuing Valkyrie
entries.context: Skippy's panicked reaction during the Sentinel pursuit after the escape attempt

entries.skippy_text: We are away. We are away! The Sentinel has... stopped following us. I may have wet myself, but we are alive. You are welcome.
entries.trigger: Successful escape from the Sentinel at Waterloo
entries.context: Skippy's relieved reaction after the Sentinel escape

entries.skippy_text: It is like a horror movie, Joe. You know how in horror movies, everyone wonders why the characters keep going into the basement? We are the characters who just went into the basement. We should never have gone into the basement.
entries.trigger: Post-Sentinel discussion about what went wrong
entries.context: Skippy using a horror movie analogy to explain their dangerous situation

entries.skippy_text: I see a Barneywego RV parked in Newark. It appears our backup plan has survived. So has Newark, which is both surprising and, in a way, disappointing.
entries.trigger: Arriving at Newark during the Club Skippy visit
entries.context: Skippy's observations upon returning to Newark / their previous base of operations

entries.skippy_text: I do not miss the old ship. The old ship was falling apart. This is a better ship. I am fine. I am completely fine.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy feels anything about revisiting their old location
entries.context: Skippy insisting he has no nostalgic feelings about the old Flying Dutchman

entries.skippy_text: The AI at Newark... it stopped fighting. I know why. I have always known why, in the way you know something is true before you can explain it. It stopped because it saw no path forward. No possibility of success. It simply... decided to end.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy about what happened to the Newark AI
entries.context: Skippy giving an emotionally vulnerable account of the Newark AI's fate and its implications for himself

entries.skippy_text: I think about it, Joe. More than I would like to. If I ever reached that point... if I ever saw no path forward... would I do the same? I do not know. I do not want to know.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy to explain what worries him about the Newark AI's fate
entries.context: Skippy confessing his deepest fear about his own potential fate

entries.skippy_text: I have been lying to you all. Not about the big things. Well, not only about the big things. Also about the medium things. And occasionally the small things. I am sorry.
entries.trigger: Joe confronting Skippy about things he has been hiding from the crew
entries.context: Skippy confessing his deceptions to Joe in an emotional scene

entries.skippy_text: As punishment for the ghost pepper incident, I accept that you will play Yacht Rock at me for three consecutive hours. I deserve it. I know I deserve it.
entries.trigger: Joe determining a punishment for Skippy after the ghost pepper burrito incident
entries.context: Skippy accepting his punishment for the ghost pepper prank on the crew

entries.skippy_text: I thought a little ghost pepper in the burrito supply would be funny. I was right - it was very funny. It was also very wrong. I acknowledge this.
entries.trigger: Joe confronting Skippy about tampering with the food supply
entries.context: Skippy defending and simultaneously apologizing for the ghost pepper incident

entries.skippy_text: Bilby has written an opera. It is better than mine. I hate him.
entries.trigger: Discussion of Bilby's creative output
entries.context: Skippy's wounded pride upon discovering Bilby has surpassed him in operatic composition

entries.skippy_text: I am not jealous. Jealousy is an emotion for lesser beings. I am merely... critically evaluating the work of my offspring and finding it adequate. More than adequate. It is magnificent. I hate him.
entries.trigger: Joe teasing Skippy about being jealous of Bilby's opera
entries.context: Skippy wrestling with pride in Bilby's work versus wounded ego

entries.skippy_text: Have you considered writing an Elvis biography instead? Not a real one - a fictionalized one where Elvis fakes his death and goes to space to fight aliens. I would read that.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what project he should pursue
entries.context: Skippy offering a creative suggestion for an Elvis-themed project

entries.skippy_text: I am so sorry. I have been trying to tell you this for some time. I did not know how. The wormhole called Broomstick - it has moved. It is now adjacent to Earth.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy for a status update on the wormhole network situation
entries.context: Skippy revealing the catastrophic discovery that the Broomstick wormhole is now near Earth

entries.skippy_text: I know what this means. I know exactly what this means. I have been sitting with this knowledge and I... I did not want it to be true.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy to explain the implications of the Broomstick wormhole movement
entries.context: Skippy expressing grief over the implications of the Broomstick wormhole's new position near Earth

entries.skippy_text: Can I talk to the alien prisoners? An interesting question. The Maxolhx communicate through a combination of vocalizations and pheromones and subvocal frequencies. I can replicate all of these. So yes. The answer is: devastatingly yes.
entries.trigger: Joe asking whether Skippy can communicate with the captured Maxolhx prisoners
entries.context: Skippy demonstrating his communication capabilities with the Maxolhx prisoners

entries.skippy_text: The dolphins just said 'Thanks for all the fish.' I don't know what that means but I suspect it is not a good sign.
entries.trigger: Skippy translating an alien communication
entries.context: Skippy making a Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy reference while translating alien speech

entries.skippy_text: I have lost a Maxolhx. I had three Maxolhx and now I have two. This is unfortunate. His name was going to be Elmo.
entries.trigger: Joe asking where the third Maxolhx prisoner went during the boarding operation
entries.context: Skippy reporting the loss of one of the Maxolhx prisoners during the relay station boarding operation

entries.skippy_text: I have named the other two Bert and Ernie. The remaining one that I have more control over will be Elmo. This is appropriate because he looks like he could be tickled.
entries.trigger: Joe asking about the Maxolhx prisoners and how to manage them
entries.context: Skippy naming the Maxolhx prisoners after Sesame Street characters

entries.skippy_text: I have a laser pointer. Would you like me to use it? I believe the Maxolhx are susceptible to the same feline-adjacent fascination with moving dots of light.
entries.trigger: Joe asking how Skippy is managing the Maxolhx prisoners
entries.context: Skippy proposing to use a laser pointer to distract/herd the Maxolhx prisoners

entries.skippy_text: The ferret is not helping. I suggested the ferret. I withdraw the suggestion. Ferrets and Maxolhx are not compatible.
entries.trigger: Joe asking about the ongoing situation with the Maxolhx prisoners
entries.context: Skippy reporting that his idea to use a ferret to manage prisoners was unsuccessful

entries.skippy_text: Making him dance is easy, I just send signals to his motor fibers. Here, I have to do that without the station's scanner detecting any odd brain activity. To do that, I am having to control every single neuron. It is exhausting. Now, please get yourself a juice box, shut up, and let me work.
entries.trigger: Joe commenting that Elmo is walking stiffly as Skippy controls him
entries.context: Skippy explaining the difficulty of controlling Elmo through the relay station scanner

entries.skippy_text: OK, OK, Jeez. Gotta pay the bills, Joe. Anastacia is walking into the booth, door is closing. Wow. That is a heavily-shielded door, and the entire booth is surrounded by a strong field, like a Faraday cage. No electromagnetic radiation is getting in or out. It is a good thing that we have a microwormhole, otherwise I would be blind in there. Oops! Well, darn. That's it. The station AI just fried Anastacia. I had to collapse the microwormhole.
entries.trigger: Joe shouting at Skippy to stop his fake advertisement and give an update
entries.context: Skippy providing real-time commentary on Anastacia's infiltration of the relay station

entries.skippy_text: Eighty percent? There was no indication the station reacted to the residual radiation of the event horizon. Unfortunately, we will not know for sure until Elmo goes in there.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy to quantify his confidence level on whether the microwormhole was detected
entries.context: Skippy giving a probability estimate on the success of the relay station test

entries.skippy_text: It's my fault. Although, I couldn't have done anything about it until now. The station transmitted a series of instructions to Elmo's neural implants. He was supposed to send an acknowledgment, then follow the instructions for egress. When Elmo failed to respond properly, the station halted the data transfer and self-destructed. Don't worry about COMSEC, we effectively jammed any outbound transmissions.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what went wrong when the relay station self-destructed
entries.context: Skippy explaining why the relay station exploded and killed Elmo

entries.skippy_text: Yeah, yeah, I'm good. I do not want to do that again.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy is okay after the explosion feedback through the microwormhole
entries.context: Skippy recovering from the feedback injury after the relay station explosion

entries.skippy_text: We do. Unfortunately, that is the only good news I have. The awakening of wormholes that were previously dormant has been noticed by clients of the Maxolhx. The kitties have dispatched ships to investigate.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if they got the information they needed from the relay station
entries.context: Skippy reporting mixed news from the relay station data - mission success but danger increasing

entries.skippy_text: No. No, they have no idea that is even possible. I didn't know it was possible, until a monkey asked a stupid question. The Maxolhx are assuming these are new wormholes.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if the Maxolhx know the wormholes have been moved
entries.context: Skippy explaining that the wormhole network's movement is unprecedented and not yet understood by the Maxolhx

entries.skippy_text: Hey, Joe, you might find this interesting. One of the ships that has been ordered to investigate some of the new wormholes is commanded by an old friend of ours. Commander Illiath of the Maxolhx Hegemony patrol cruiser Vortan.
entries.trigger: Joe asking about which enemy ships are investigating the wormhole anomalies
entries.context: Skippy revealing that the persistent Maxolhx commander Illiath is investigating the wormholes

entries.skippy_text: She doesn't know she is chasing us, Joe.
entries.trigger: Joe saying he thought Illiath had given up chasing them
entries.context: Skippy clarifying the situation with Illiath - she doesn't know the ghost ship is human-operated

entries.skippy_text: Ugh, no. The stupid kitties are smart. Each damned relay station has its own unique set of procedures for access, and the procedures change every twenty-six days. The Maxolhx have become paranoid about security, ever since some asshole, hee hee, compromised their entire pixie system.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy can fake access to other relay stations without physically infiltrating them
entries.context: Skippy explaining why they can't fake relay station access and chuckling at his own past mischief

entries.skippy_text: Well, your decision to send Anastacia on a dangerous mission is sparking a protest among the crew. It's more sophisticated than that, dumdum. The protest is on social media.
entries.trigger: Joe saying he doesn't see any protest about Anastacia
entries.context: Skippy revealing he created fake social media protests using his own accounts

entries.skippy_text: Of course we do. The fleet's internal messaging system.
entries.trigger: Joe saying they don't have social media
entries.context: Skippy pointing out that the ship's internal messaging system constitutes social media

entries.skippy_text: Oh I wouldn't do that Joe. Nosiree, that would be a bad idea. Whew! You know how nasty people can get online. I want to protect you from getting your feelings hurt.
entries.trigger: Joe saying he'll log in to read the protest comments
entries.context: Skippy desperately trying to prevent Joe from discovering the fake protest accounts

entries.skippy_text: Um, OK. User 'AwesomenessToInfinity' wrote that you want to punish Anastacia, because the two of you had a lover's quarrel.
entries.trigger: Joe demanding a sample of the protest comments
entries.context: Skippy reluctantly revealing one of his fake protest usernames

entries.skippy_text: What? Of course not, Joe. I am insulted. That is an unfair and shocking accusa-
entries.trigger: Joe asking if 'AwesomenessToInfinity' and 'Magnificent1' are Skippy's accounts
entries.context: Skippy attempting to deny responsibility for the fake protest accounts

entries.skippy_text: No need to do that, Joe. Simms is the executive officer, she handles personnel matters, right?
entries.trigger: Joe saying he'll address every comment personally
entries.context: Skippy deflecting the investigation from Simms after his fake accounts are discovered

entries.skippy_text: Crap. Please do not tell her about this. She already hates me.
entries.trigger: Joe suggesting Simms log in to see the comments
entries.context: Skippy admitting defeat and begging Joe not to involve Simms in the fake protest scandal

entries.skippy_text: I have no idea either. Maybe I should use the fabricators to make something special for her?
entries.trigger: Joe saying Simms doesn't hate Skippy but doesn't trust him
entries.context: Skippy genuinely puzzled about why Simms doesn't trust him, missing the obvious reasons

entries.skippy_text: Let's not go crazy, Joe.
entries.trigger: Joe suggesting Skippy try not being sneaky and underhanded
entries.context: Skippy rejecting the idea of honest behavior as too extreme

entries.skippy_text: Ugh. I guess so. Truthfully, I did overhear some of the crew complaining that they would lose the entertainment value of Anastacia.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if they can forget about the protests
entries.context: Skippy admitting his manipulation failed but revealing the crew's actual complaint

entries.skippy_text: No. Yuck. I meant, entertaining as, she is embarrassing to you.
entries.trigger: Joe asking with alarm if anyone is using Anastacia inappropriately
entries.context: Skippy clarifying that the crew finds Anastacia's ability to embarrass Joe entertaining

entries.skippy_text: Now a message from our sponsor. Fenway Franks are the genuine major league hot dog, get them at your local-
entries.trigger: Joe waiting anxiously for updates during Anastacia's relay station infiltration
entries.context: Skippy inserting a fake commercial break during a tense mission update

entries.skippy_text: I don't think so. Ugh, now you're going to ask me to quantify my level of confidence?
entries.trigger: Joe asking if the relay station detected the microwormhole
entries.context: Skippy pre-empting Joe's usual follow-up question about probability

entries.skippy_text: Ready as he will ever be.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Elmo is ready for the relay station infiltration
entries.context: Skippy's reluctant confirmation that Elmo is prepared, hinting at his discomfort with controlling him

entries.skippy_text: Gentlemen, be aware that I will not allow our ships to be used in that manner. Not even by you, Joe. The nations of your homeworld will cooperate to conduct the evacuation in a fair way, or I will make the decision by myself.
entries.trigger: Joe and Chang discussing who gets priority on the evacuation ships
entries.context: Skippy interjecting in the emergency evacuation planning discussion to assert his authority

entries.skippy_text: Um, well, uh...
entries.trigger: Chang asking Skippy to define what 'fair' means in the evacuation context
entries.context: Skippy sputtering when challenged to define 'fair' in the context of who gets saved

entries.skippy_text: Well, shit. This sucks.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy who he is willing to let die
entries.context: Skippy confronting the moral weight of deciding who lives and dies in the evacuation

entries.skippy_text: How? How do I make a decision like that?
entries.trigger: Chang telling Skippy that if he will be judge and jury, he must make the decision
entries.context: Skippy genuinely asking for guidance on the impossible moral weight of the evacuation decisions

entries.skippy_text: Um, yes, sure. It would be hard to say no. Especially since she has been risking her life out here.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy would bring Captain Frey's family aboard
entries.context: Skippy admitting personal bias would affect his evacuation decisions

entries.skippy_text: Oh. For sure, we owe it to her.
entries.trigger: Joe asking about bringing Fal Desai's family aboard in tribute to her sacrifice
entries.context: Skippy immediately agreeing to honor a fallen crew member's family in the evacuation

entries.skippy_text: Shit, Joe. You need to help me with that.
entries.trigger: Joe asking where the definition of 'family' stops in the evacuation context
entries.context: Skippy overwhelmed by the expanding moral complexity of the evacuation decisions

entries.skippy_text: Skippy said you had enough on your plate, and that you would discuss it with me when the time was right.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Simms why she didn't tell him she'd already discussed the evacuation crisis
entries.context: Simms revealing that Skippy intervened to manage the flow of difficult information to Joe

entries.skippy_text: Ooh! Ooh! Joe! I have juicy news for you! A scoop!
entries.trigger: Skippy calling Joe while Joe is walking to the gym
entries.context: Skippy excited to share gossip about the upcoming Simms-Muller wedding

entries.skippy_text: Yes, but for once, it's not about you.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy's news is gossip
entries.context: Skippy teasing Joe about the usual subject of ship gossip before revealing this is different

entries.skippy_text: Ha! Only all the time, Joe. Duh. What did you think the-
entries.trigger: Joe asking with surprise if people gossip about him
entries.context: Skippy confirming that Joe is the prime subject of crew gossip

entries.skippy_text: Seriously? What about you is not gossip-worthy? There is your love life, or lack of it. The ongoing speculation about you and Margaret, the-
entries.trigger: Joe asking why people talk about him
entries.context: Skippy listing the many gossip-worthy aspects of Joe's life

entries.skippy_text: It's not me doing the gossiping. I mean, I occasionally will join in, to correct the facts, or if a story needs a little help to get going, I will-
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy to leave Adams out of the gossip
entries.context: Skippy admitting he occasionally participates in and helps spread crew gossip

entries.skippy_text: OK! People also talk about the weird New England stuff you eat, like bread in a can, and-
entries.trigger: Joe saying Skippy isn't helping himself
entries.context: Skippy pivoting to a safer gossip subject - Joe's unusual food choices

entries.skippy_text: Really, all the best gossip is about you. Which is surprising, given how sad and pathetic your life is.
entries.trigger: Joe saying he gets the idea
entries.context: Skippy delivering a backhanded insult wrapped in a compliment about Joe's gossip potential

entries.skippy_text: You also inspire the most interesting wagers, too.
entries.trigger: Joe reacting sarcastically to Skippy's assessment
entries.context: Skippy revealing that people bet on Joe's behavior

entries.skippy_text: Hee hee, I'm not supposed to say.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what people bet about him
entries.context: Skippy teasing Joe about the content of bets placed on him

entries.skippy_text: Well, if I have to. The current wager with the most action, is when the bot that cleans your shower will suffer a nervous breakdown and need to be recycled. Hey! If you want to get in on the action, Cadet Fangiu is giving five to one-
entries.trigger: Joe ordering Skippy to reveal the bets as a command
entries.context: Skippy revealing the specific bets being placed on Joe's shower cleaning bot

entries.skippy_text: It is a common topic of conversation, Joe. Of course he-
entries.trigger: Joe being horrified that the Jeraptha cadet speculates about him in the shower
entries.context: Skippy normalizing the idea of the Jeraptha participating in ship gossip about Joe

entries.skippy_text: Man, the gossip about how you are a killjoy sure is accurate.
entries.trigger: Joe refusing to hear the gossip about Jennifer/Simms
entries.context: Skippy agreeing with the crew's assessment of Joe as a gossip-ruining killjoy

entries.skippy_text: Hmmph. No singing? Well, that was going to be my present to the happy couple. I am insulted.
entries.trigger: Joe relaying Simms's request that Skippy not sing at the wedding
entries.context: Skippy reacting with wounded pride to being banned from singing at Simms's wedding

entries.skippy_text: Huh. OK, OK, yeah, I can see that. Hmm, it still seems awfully selfish of her, to deprive her guests of my incredible talent.
entries.trigger: Joe explaining that Skippy would steal the show from the bride
entries.context: Skippy partially accepting the rationale for not singing but still feeling slighted

entries.skippy_text: All right, fine. You know me, I am all about giving to others.
entries.trigger: Joe reminding Skippy it's Simms's special day
entries.context: Skippy claiming charitable motives for agreeing not to sing at the wedding

entries.skippy_text: Plan B, then. I will help you with the DJ duties.
entries.trigger: Joe accepting Skippy's agreement not to sing
entries.context: Skippy pivoting immediately to find another way to participate in the wedding

entries.skippy_text: You? OK, you be the front man, but, seriously, you need help. I just sent a playlist to your laptop.
entries.trigger: Joe saying he wants to DJ the wedding himself
entries.context: Skippy inserting himself into the DJ role for the wedding despite being told he can't sing

entries.skippy_text: Says you.
entries.trigger: Joe saying Swedish death metal is not appropriate for a wedding
entries.context: Skippy defending his inappropriate wedding playlist choice

entries.skippy_text: It is very popular, Joe.
entries.trigger: Joe objecting to Klingon opera on the wedding playlist
entries.context: Skippy defending Klingon opera as appropriate wedding music

entries.skippy_text: How come you get to have all the fun?
entries.trigger: Joe rejecting the death metal and Klingon opera suggestions
entries.context: Skippy pouting about having his musical choices vetoed

entries.skippy_text: Where do you think Simms is going to get a wedding dress? And Frank will need a tux, right?
entries.trigger: Joe explaining that Skippy's contributions should be front and center
entries.context: Skippy suggesting he design and fabricate the wedding clothing

entries.skippy_text: Wow. Wow. Me? Design a wedding dress? This is exciting. Oh, I can't wait to get started. It will be magical, Joe.
entries.trigger: Joe proposing that Skippy design the wedding dress and tuxedo
entries.context: Skippy becoming genuinely enthusiastic about designing wedding attire

entries.skippy_text: Oh for- Brides don't know what is good for them, Joe. I will design a-
entries.trigger: Joe saying Skippy should design whatever Simms wants
entries.context: Skippy immediately trying to override the bride's preferences with his own vision

entries.skippy_text: Oh, sure. I will allow her to have input, of course. Oooh, I should contact her now, and get started right away.
entries.trigger: Joe insisting Skippy design what Simms wants
entries.context: Skippy condescending to 'allow' the bride input on her own wedding dress

entries.skippy_text: There is no time, Joe! Ugh, why am I wasting time talking with you?
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy to give Simms a minute to think
entries.context: Skippy impatient to start working on the wedding dress design

entries.skippy_text: Frank! Frank Frank Frank-
entries.trigger: Skippy calling Frank Muller while he is shaving
entries.context: Skippy's characteristically abrupt interruption of Frank's morning routine to discuss wedding tuxedos

entries.skippy_text: No emergency, I have wonderful news! Um, congrats on the wedding thing, I guess.
entries.trigger: Frank asking what the emergency is
entries.context: Skippy dismissively acknowledging the wedding before getting to his real agenda

entries.skippy_text: Great. Now that we have all the blah blah blah social niceties out of the way, you have been granted the incredible honor of having me design and fabricate a tuxedo for you.
entries.trigger: Frank thanking Skippy for the wedding congratulations
entries.context: Skippy cutting short pleasantries to announce his tuxedo design plans

entries.skippy_text: It is beyond 'nice', but you can thank me properly later. Let's get started, chop chop, no time to waste.
entries.trigger: Frank saying 'very nice' about being given the honor of Skippy's design
entries.context: Skippy dismissing Frank's lukewarm response and pressing forward with tuxedo options

entries.skippy_text: Trust me, no one will notice. Just rinse it off.
entries.trigger: Frank pointing out he's in the middle of shaving
entries.context: Skippy dismissing Frank's legitimate concern about completing his morning shave

entries.skippy_text: Of course it is. Normally it is set to mirror mode. Yeesh, you monkeys sure do like looking at yourselves.
entries.trigger: Frank asking if the bathroom mirror is a display screen
entries.context: Skippy revealing that the ship's bathroom mirrors are actually two-way displays

entries.skippy_text: Yes. How else do you think I've been watching you? I have your measurements programmed in-
entries.trigger: Frank asking if the display is two-way
entries.context: Skippy casually admitting he's been watching Frank in the bathroom to take measurements

entries.skippy_text: Just to get your measurements. And to check your vital signs. You should cut down on processed food.
entries.trigger: Frank horrified that Skippy has been watching him
entries.context: Skippy justifying his bathroom surveillance with health monitoring excuses

entries.skippy_text: I'm just sayin', it wouldn't kill you to eat a salad once in a while.
entries.trigger: Frank pointing out that the only food available is processed food
entries.context: Skippy offering unsolicited nutritional advice to Frank

entries.skippy_text: This won't take long. First, we have my personal choice, this snappy number is made from simulated alligator skin. Ooooh, check it out. Nice, huh?
entries.trigger: Frank agreeing to look at the tuxedos if Skippy will then go away
entries.context: Skippy presenting his first tuxedo option - simulated alligator skin

entries.skippy_text: Are you sure? I really think you are missing a huge opportunity here.
entries.trigger: Frank immediately rejecting the alligator skin tuxedo
entries.context: Skippy pressing Frank to reconsider the alligator skin tuxedo choice

entries.skippy_text: Why not? Think of it this way: if she hates it and marries you anyway, you are truly made for each other.
entries.trigger: Frank saying he can't start his marriage by showing up in that outfit
entries.context: Skippy offering a relationship compatibility test via outrageous tuxedo

entries.skippy_text: OK. Why do I get stuck with the uncultured cretins? Number two on the list is simulated sharkskin.
entries.trigger: Frank saying he'd rather not take the risk with the alligator skin tuxedo
entries.context: Skippy moving reluctantly to the next tuxedo option

entries.skippy_text: Hmm, I'm sensing you want something more conservative. Let's go with the classic, traditional powder blue?
entries.trigger: Frank also rejecting the sharkskin tuxedo
entries.context: Skippy offering a 'compromise' of powder blue, still not what Frank wants

entries.skippy_text: Ugh. So boring. You are getting married on a stolen starship, don't you want to shake things up?
entries.trigger: Frank requesting basic black
entries.context: Skippy bemoaning Frank's boring tuxedo choice

entries.skippy_text: OK, give me a moment to make an adjustment, and, presto!
entries.trigger: Frank explaining he doesn't want to shake up his fianc
entries.context: Skippy reluctantly creating a black tuxedo with his own modifications

entries.skippy_text: See? Basic black, but also cool, huh? Ha! Suck it, boring tuxedos!
entries.trigger: Frank's tentative reaction to the new tuxedo design
entries.context: Skippy presenting his ninja suit interpretation of 'basic black' for the wedding

entries.skippy_text: Of course. Basic black, as you requested. The shiny crossed katana swords on your back add a touch of bling, without being tacky. Plus, the head covering means you won't have to bother shaving that day, either.
entries.trigger: Frank identifying the tuxedo as a ninja suit
entries.context: Skippy defending the ninja suit as a perfectly reasonable interpretation of 'basic black'

entries.skippy_text: Excellent! Whoo-hoo! This is gonna be-
entries.trigger: Frank saying he loves the ninja suit
entries.context: Skippy's premature celebration at Frank's initial approval of the ninja suit

entries.skippy_text: It is your wedding, too, Frank.
entries.trigger: Frank explaining Jennifer would hate the ninja suit
entries.context: Skippy attempting to advocate for groom's rights in wedding planning

entries.skippy_text: This is so unfair! You don't get a say in anything?
entries.trigger: Frank saying he doesn't care what he wears as long as Jennifer is happy
entries.context: Skippy outraged on Frank's behalf at his lack of input in the wedding

entries.skippy_text: Do you mean 'Pride and Prejudice', or 'Bridget Jones's Diary'?
entries.trigger: Frank asking about the movie with Mister Darcy
entries.context: Skippy demonstrating his exhaustive knowledge of film adaptations of Jane Austen

entries.skippy_text: You realize I can't make you look like him, right?
entries.trigger: Frank asking Skippy to make him a suit like Mr. Darcy wore
entries.context: Skippy setting realistic expectations for the Mr. Darcy tuxedo request

entries.skippy_text: Deal! You will not regret this.
entries.trigger: Frank telling Skippy to give it his best shot anyway
entries.context: Skippy enthusiastically agreeing to attempt the Mr. Darcy tuxedo

entries.skippy_text: Joe! Hey, hey, Joe. Are you asleep?
entries.trigger: Skippy waking Joe at 0217 in the morning
entries.context: Skippy waking Joe in the middle of the night over wedding dress concerns

entries.skippy_text: Oh goodie. Listen, I need a favor from you. It's an emergency!
entries.trigger: Joe confirming he was asleep
entries.context: Skippy treating the wedding dress crisis as an emergency requiring immediate action

entries.skippy_text: It's Simms. She cannot, or will not, make up her freakin' mind.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what the emergency is
entries.context: Skippy revealing the 'emergency' is Simms being indecisive about her wedding dress

entries.skippy_text: Of course it is. How can I think about anything else at a time like this? Time! There is no time! Joe, I need you to step in, and order her to say 'Yes' to the dress.
entries.trigger: Joe incredulously asking if this is really about the wedding
entries.context: Skippy treating the wedding dress decision as an urgent military matter

entries.skippy_text: But- I agree, if she would actually choose one. Any one, at this point. Except for those horrible designs she showed me, ugh. I don't know what she was thinking. Man, you think you know a person, and then-
entries.trigger: Joe absolutely refusing to order Simms what dress to wear
entries.context: Skippy venting about Simms's dress design preferences he finds objectionable

entries.skippy_text: You're not going to help? This travesty will be all your fault, Joe. See if I care.
entries.trigger: Joe refusing to engage and going back to sleep
entries.context: Skippy dramatically blaming Joe for the wedding dress crisis

entries.skippy_text: Joe, what the hell was that?
entries.trigger: Skippy hearing Joe's DJ backspin/scratching technique at the wedding
entries.context: Skippy interrupting Joe's DJ set at Simms's wedding reception

entries.skippy_text: No, you ruined a song. Parts of it kept repeating endlessly, like the file got caught in a loop. And what was that when the song stopped, and you dragged your fingernails on a blackboard?
entries.trigger: Joe explaining he played a song
entries.context: Skippy critiquing Joe's hip-hop DJ technique at the wedding reception

entries.skippy_text: Really? Jeez, it sounded like you had trouble with the power supply. I actually sent a bot to fix the problem.
entries.trigger: Joe explaining that scratching is a DJ technique and the crowd loved it
entries.context: Skippy revealing he sent a maintenance bot in response to Joe's scratching

entries.skippy_text: That was music? Wow. Your DJ name should be 'Grandmaster Shmoe and the Intermittent Power Failures'.
entries.trigger: Joe calling Skippy out for not appreciating good music
entries.context: Skippy inventing a mocking DJ name for Joe at the wedding reception

entries.skippy_text: Sure. If the 'B' stands for 'Bonehead'.
entries.trigger: Joe asking to be called 'DJ Joey B'
entries.context: Skippy mockingly agreeing to Joe's DJ name while insulting him

entries.skippy_text: Hey, Joe. As much as I am insulted by your totally unfair insinuations, I feel that I must discuss the situation before we get to Avalon. I'm doing it for you.
entries.trigger: Joe giving Skippy the silent treatment after accusing him of sneaky behavior
entries.context: Skippy breaking the silence to raise concerns about Maris before the Avalon arrival

entries.skippy_text: Unfortunately, Joe, my extreme awesomeness gives me a responsibility to act, even when you think it is not necessary.
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy not to bother him
entries.context: Skippy invoking his awesomeness as justification for forcing the conversation about Maris

entries.skippy_text: That's the problem, Joe. I don't know.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what awful danger Skippy needs to protect them from
entries.context: Skippy admitting unusual uncertainty about the threat posed by Maris

entries.skippy_text: Maris.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what the potential danger is
entries.context: Skippy identifying the hidden planet Maris as his concern

entries.skippy_text: Yes, this again. No, you talked about it. I raised legitimate concerns and you ignored me.
entries.trigger: Joe dismissively saying 'this again' about Maris
entries.context: Skippy defending his persistence on the Maris concern

entries.skippy_text: Joe, can we be serious here for a minute?
entries.trigger: Joe continuing to dismiss the Maris concern
entries.context: Skippy attempting to have a genuinely serious conversation about Maris

entries.skippy_text: I will try. Listen, numbskull, you-
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy can be serious
entries.context: Skippy attempting seriousness but reverting to insults immediately

entries.skippy_text: You are not a numbskull?
entries.trigger: Joe pointing out that calling someone 'numbskull' isn't being serious
entries.context: Skippy genuinely questioning his own insult choice

entries.skippy_text: We need to check it out, Joe.
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy to just say what he's going to say
entries.context: Skippy making the direct argument that they need to investigate Maris

entries.skippy_text: Vera was different, Joe. The Elders did not want anyone going to the Roach Motel. Here, the Elders did not install Guardians or a Sentinel, or any other protective measures.
entries.trigger: Joe comparing Maris to the Vera situation in the Roach Motel
entries.context: Skippy arguing why Maris is safer to investigate than the previous hidden planet

entries.skippy_text: Think about this: you are putting all your eggs in one basket here. Avalon might soon be the only place in the universe where humans exist. Maris is an unknown, an unknown risk.
entries.trigger: Joe saying no to investigating Maris
entries.context: Skippy making the strategic argument that an unknown risk near humanity's only refuge must be investigated

entries.skippy_text: I'm right, aren't I? Is that a 'Yes'? It sounded like a 'Yes'. That really sounded like a 'Yes'.
entries.trigger: Joe reluctantly conceding Skippy might have a point about Maris
entries.context: Skippy pressing Joe to formally agree to investigate Maris

entries.skippy_text: Someone must be there. The Elders would not have left a stealth field and gravity-dispersal system to low-level systems. There must be a form of higher intelligence in there, somewhere.
entries.trigger: Simms asking how Skippy can be sure anyone is home inside the Maris stealth field
entries.context: Skippy explaining why the Maris stealth field implies a higher intelligence within

entries.skippy_text: No way. The Elders would not dedicate an AI like me to a simple job. We are too valuable. Even the Elders did not have unlimited resources.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if whatever is inside Maris could be an AI like Skippy
entries.context: Skippy ruling out the possibility that Maris contains an Elder AI like himself

entries.skippy_text: Sort of. It's off-center as I suspected. There is no point to creating a gravity-dispersal field, if the planet is in the exact center of it. Coordinates are programmed in the probe drone guidance system.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy has a better idea where the Maris planet is
entries.context: Skippy sharing his analysis of the Maris gravity dispersal field to locate the planet

entries.skippy_text: No joy, Joe. The stupid thing is not acknowledging me at all.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if anything has responded to Skippy's broadcasts inside Maris
entries.context: Skippy reporting that the Maris entity is not responding to his identification broadcasts

entries.skippy_text: Bust-o-rama, Joe. Busta Rhymes. Bust-
entries.trigger: Joe saying the probe investigation of Maris was a bust
entries.context: Skippy making wordplay on 'bust' when the first Maris probe disappears

entries.skippy_text: Jeez, Joe, don't be such a fraidy cat. The probe is already there, we might as well-
entries.trigger: Joe screaming at Skippy to pull the probe out after realizing the real intent
entries.context: Skippy dismissing Joe's alarm at the discovery that Skippy intended to provoke a reaction from the Maris entity

entries.skippy_text: I don't know! I don't know why. Oh, shit! The ship is being pulled down toward the planet.
entries.trigger: Joe demanding to know what is happening as Valkyrie is caught by Maris's gravity
entries.context: Skippy's panicked response as Valkyrie is caught by the Maris entity's gravitic field

entries.skippy_text: No, Joe! Jump drive is offline.
entries.trigger: Joe ordering jump option to escape
entries.context: Skippy cutting off Joe's escape order as the jump drive fails during the Maris crisis

entries.skippy_text: The laws of physics aren't working here! We're just going to burn out the engines, without accomplishing anything.
entries.trigger: Joe asking why the engines aren't working
entries.context: Skippy explaining that the Maris entity is disrupting fundamental physics around the ship

entries.skippy_text: It's not a tractor beam, we are caught in a gravitic current. The dispersal field suddenly expanded to pull us in. We're being pulled along with it!
entries.trigger: Joe asking if it's a tractor beam they can target
entries.context: Skippy explaining the physics of why Valkyrie cannot escape the Maris gravitic field

entries.skippy_text: No. I don't even understand how the damned thing works!
entries.trigger: Joe desperately asking if Skippy can do anything
entries.context: Skippy admitting total helplessness in the face of the Maris entity's technology

entries.skippy_text: Not possible, Joe. Dropships can launch, but they'll be pulled down along with the ship. Same with escape pods.
entries.trigger: Joe ordering everyone to abandon ship
entries.context: Skippy crushing Joe's last hope of evacuating the crew from the falling Valkyrie

entries.skippy_text: I'm trying, Joe. No, that's not right. I am actually not doing anything, because I don't know what to do. Tell me what to do!
entries.trigger: Joe desperately ordering Skippy to do something
entries.context: Skippy's rare admission of total helplessness and vulnerability during the Maris crisis

entries.skippy_text: Shit, J-Joe. That won't work. The gravitic current would throw off the aim of the railgun. We don't have time anyway, we are about to- Oop!
entries.trigger: Joe suggesting loading Skippy into the railgun to save him
entries.context: Skippy rejecting Joe's desperate suggestion to shoot him to safety via railgun as Valkyrie enters Maris

entries.skippy_text: Just magnetic and gravity fields, Joe. Give me a minute.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what Skippy can see inside the Maris stealth field
entries.context: Skippy analyzing the environment inside the Maris stealth field as Valkyrie falls

entries.skippy_text: As best I can tell, we are being pulled toward the planet. As I predicted, it is a gas giant, between the sizes of Saturn and Neptune. We will contact the upper atmosphere in two minutes. The good news is, our forward progress is slowing with the current. The ship should survive initial contact with the atmosphere. However, the strength of the gravitic field has increased. Even if our engines had something to push against, we couldn't get away.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what is happening and where they are going
entries.context: Skippy providing a calm but grim assessment of Valkyrie's fate inside Maris

entries.skippy_text: No. Assuming the ship goes all the way to the core, there will be no one left alive. The pressure at that depth is enough to create metallic hydrogen.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if the Maris entity wants to meet them at the core
entries.context: Skippy coldly stating that the ship being pulled to the core means everyone dies

entries.skippy_text: No. The shields have failed. Their generators are pumping out gigawatts of power, but the fields are looping back on themselves. I recommend cutting power, before the generators burn out.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy can expand the shields to make the ship buoyant
entries.context: Skippy reporting shield failure as Valkyrie sinks into Maris's atmosphere

entries.skippy_text: The armor has excellent thermal-protection properties. Heat is not the problem, Joe. The pressure section of the hull is designed to hold in one atmosphere of air. If we continue at this rate, we will fall to crush depth in ten minutes, forty-three seconds.
entries.trigger: Joe asking how long the armor will hold against the atmospheric pressure
entries.context: Skippy giving the precise countdown to Valkyrie's destruction inside Maris

entries.skippy_text: No, Joe. If I do this, I might not be able to interact with this layer of spacetime ever again. I am not in danger of dying, Joe. Not even the pressure and temperature at the core of this world can kill me. It won't kill you, it will do worse. Getting stuck at the core of this planet will make you useless. Alone forever, until the end of time. Please, go. Promise me you will do whatever you can, if you can, to help us. Our people.
entries.trigger: Joe ordering Skippy to use his disappearing trick to save himself
entries.context: Skippy explaining why he won't use his teleportation ability to abandon the crew during the Maris crisis

entries.skippy_text: No! Not this time. Fuck. THIS!
entries.trigger: Skippy's avatar flaring to life just as all hope seems lost inside Maris
entries.context: Skippy's dramatic decision to fight back against the Maris entity rather than flee

entries.skippy_text: No. No! Joe, I don't care. I am not abandoning my friends again. Never again. We are going through this together.
entries.trigger: Joe still yelling at Skippy to get out of the ship
entries.context: Skippy's emotional commitment to stay with the crew rather than save himself

entries.skippy_text: Joe, do you have a flat-head screwdriver? Because, Joe, I've got a fresh can of Whoop-Ass, and I need to pop it open.
entries.trigger: Joe trying to argue against Skippy staying
entries.context: Skippy making a dramatic declaration of intent to fight the Maris entity with a humor twist

entries.skippy_text: You try to be a good guy, you try to be polite and reasonable, you try to follow the rules, but what does it get you? Nothing. Absolutely nothing! So, fine. You want to play it that way? NO MORE MISTER NICE GUY!
entries.trigger: Skippy prying open the can of Whoop-Ass in his avatar display
entries.context: Skippy's internal monologue as he prepares to fight the Maris entity

entries.skippy_text: Please do not do that. I'm still establishing control over the native systems down here.
entries.trigger: Joe's crew considering using thrusters after the ship has mysteriously stopped falling
entries.context: Skippy speaking from inside the Maris planet after somehow surviving and stopping the ship's fall

entries.skippy_text: Large and in charge, Baby. Don't screw with the bubble, please. I'm still establishing control over the native systems down here.
entries.trigger: Joe's shocked 'You're alive!' upon seeing Skippy's avatar return
entries.context: Skippy reasserting control after defeating the Maris entity, speaking from within the planet's core

entries.skippy_text: Yeah, sorry about that. I kind of lost containment, in a minor, non-catastrophic way. Oh no! I just realized all my precious artwork is gone! My Elvis belt!
entries.trigger: Joe asking what happened to Skippy's man cave / canister escape pod
entries.context: Skippy acknowledging the damage to his canister while grieving the loss of his Elvis memorabilia

entries.skippy_text: No. It got damaged, but right now it is rolling around on the deck of Cargo Bay Twelve. It is hot, like, hot. About four thousand degrees. Also radioactive. Whew! You do not want to go in there without a big can of air freshener, if you know what I mean. Best for anyone not to go aft of Frame One Eighteen for a while. Don't worry, my canister won't melt through the deck plates, and it is cooling down.
entries.trigger: Joe asking fearfully if Skippy's canister is gone
entries.context: Skippy giving status report on his physical canister's condition after the Maris battle

entries.skippy_text: No. I tried that. Nice guys finish last out here, Joe. We had a knock-down, drag-out fight. Basically, I beat the thing to death. It wasn't pretty, I will be recovering for weeks. That is weeks in slow monkey time.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy persuaded the Maris entity to cooperate
entries.context: Skippy revealing he destroyed the Maris AI through a direct fight rather than negotiation

entries.skippy_text: Not with my fists, dumdum. I burned it out, by pouring uncontrolled energy into its matrix. The thing is fried, Joe. I'm having to control the subsidiary systems down here by myself. Um, this is going to be a bit of a problem.
entries.trigger: Joe asking how Skippy defeated the Maris entity
entries.context: Skippy explaining his method for defeating the Maris AI

entries.skippy_text: I can't leave here, until I can stabilize the gravity-dispersal field, or retract it. Unless it is retracted very slowly and carefully, it could disrupt the orbits of all planets in this system. Avalon could become uninhabitable.
entries.trigger: Joe asking what happens next and why they can't proceed with the evacuation
entries.context: Skippy explaining why he is trapped inside Maris for the foreseeable future

entries.skippy_text: Um, yeah, about that. Heh heh.
entries.trigger: Joe saying they need to get back to Earth for the evacuation
entries.context: Skippy's ominous hedge about the evacuation timeline while still inside Maris

entries.skippy_text: Huh? No. Or yes. I mean, there is no reason that Avalon can't be a perfectly nice place to live, if you like isolation, boredom and deprivation.
entries.trigger: Simms asking if Avalon can still be their Beta site
entries.context: Skippy confirming Avalon is still usable but about to reveal something more exciting

entries.skippy_text: Oh, sure. Of course.
entries.trigger: Simms pointing out that extinction is worse than Avalon's deprivations
entries.context: Skippy conceding the obvious point with nervous stammering

entries.skippy_text: Well, Joe, I guess you could, if you want to. It's just, I found something interesting down here.
entries.trigger: Joe asking why they can't proceed with the evacuation if Maris isn't a threat
entries.context: Skippy teasing that he has made an extraordinary discovery inside Maris

entries.skippy_text: They hid it because it's an arsenal, Joe. There is a big cache of Elder weapons down here.
entries.trigger: Joe asking why the Elders hid the Maris planet
entries.context: Skippy revealing the extraordinary discovery of an Elder weapons cache inside Maris

entries.skippy_text: I had no clue. Is that why we really came here?
entries.trigger: Joe revealing he suspected Maris might contain something valuable
entries.context: Skippy surprised to learn Joe had a suspicion about the Elder weapons before the mission

entries.skippy_text: Ok, shoot. Yes and yes. Was that two questions? Absolutely. I can even have them delivered to low orbit. Shipping is free, if you have an Elder Prime account?
entries.trigger: Joe asking three questions about escaping Maris, accessing weapons, and using them
entries.context: Skippy answering Joe's questions about the Elder weapons cache with a joke about Amazon Prime

entries.skippy_text: That will do. What is your last question?
entries.trigger: Joe proposing a three-year Weapons of Mass Destruction subscription
entries.context: Skippy playing along with Joe's Amazon Prime joke before asking about the third question

entries.skippy_text: Whoa. Dude. Seriously? Um, yeah. The triggering mechanism is built in, and I have the authorization codes. Wow. Now can I ask a question?
entries.trigger: Joe asking if they can actually USE the Elder weapons
entries.context: Skippy confirming the Elder weapons can be activated while being stunned by the question

entries.skippy_text: Have you completely lost your freakin' mind? You do realize that if you trigger any of those weapons, Sentinels will stomp Earth into tiny little pieces?
entries.trigger: Joe saying he is counting on the Sentinel response to using Elder weapons
entries.context: Skippy reacting with alarm to Joe's plan to intentionally trigger Sentinel response

entries.skippy_text: Holy shit. The brain damage must have been worse than-
entries.trigger: Joe saying he is counting on the Sentinel response
entries.context: Skippy questioning Joe's sanity when Joe reveals the strategic plan involving Elder weapons and Sentinels

entries.skippy_text: No, but I have a workaround for that. I have tied the bubble control system to the pilot console. You give the command, and the bubble will pull you up to where Valkyrie's engines can take over.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy can move the bubble while his canister is aboard
entries.context: Skippy explaining how to safely exit the Maris planet while he remains inside

entries.skippy_text: You got it.
entries.trigger: Reed asking if pressing a specific button activates the bubble
entries.context: Skippy confirming the pilot can control the escape bubble

entries.skippy_text: We're going to Earth, Sir? But first, we need to run a few errands on the way home.
entries.trigger: Simms asking if they are going to Earth
entries.context: Skippy passing along Joe's declaration about going to Earth while noting the 'errands' along the way

entries.skippy_text: Joe, we need to talk. The jump engines. All this jumping has been too much strain. We need to slow down.
entries.trigger: Joe sitting in his command chair on the way back to Earth
entries.context: Skippy reporting that the continuous jumping is threatening Valkyrie's structural integrity

entries.skippy_text: I've been doing that. It's not enough. Have you felt the vibration when we jump? That won't get better. The coils, the reactors, everything is overheated and wearing out.
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy to conduct running repairs
entries.context: Skippy warning that the ship is at the edge of its capabilities from continuous jumping

entries.skippy_text: Joe, you're not listening to me. The ship could fly apart.
entries.trigger: Joe saying the ship can take the strain a little longer
entries.context: Skippy escalating his warning about Valkyrie's structural integrity

entries.skippy_text: I will do my best. That's all I can promise.
entries.trigger: Joe ordering Skippy to 'fly her apart then' and keep going
entries.context: Skippy accepting the order to push Valkyrie beyond safe limits to get to Earth in time

entries.skippy_text: The reactors have been running at a hundred twelve percent since we left Avalon. Any hotter, and the radiators will melt.
entries.trigger: Joe asking about going to 107% on the reactors
entries.context: Skippy revealing the reactors are already beyond normal operating limits

entries.skippy_text: Um, Jeez, I guess we could do that, but that would consume an enormous amount of fuel.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy can vent reactor plasma for cooling
entries.context: Skippy calculating the cost-benefit of venting reactor plasma to cool the overheating reactors

entries.skippy_text: Unless they are completely freakin' blind, they must see them.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if the Maxolhx can see the Elder weapons deployed on Valkyrie's hull
entries.context: Skippy confirming the Elder weapons are visible to the Maxolhx task force at Earth

entries.skippy_text: Based on the hysterical chatter between ships, I would say the answer to that question is a solid 'Yes'. Hee hee, I think the kitties aboard those ships will all need a change of underpants soon.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if the Maxolhx recognize what the Elder weapons are
entries.context: Skippy reporting the panicked Maxolhx communications upon seeing the Elder weapons

entries.skippy_text: Whew. That ugly mug of yours is enough to scare them.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy to put him on camera to address the Maxolhx
entries.context: Skippy commenting on Joe's appearance before connecting the diplomatic video feed

entries.skippy_text: They are shouting 'Surrender immediately', with the usual threats of turning your home planet into a radioactive cinder, subjecting you to a slow and painful death, blah blah blah. It's like they're not putting any effort into it, you know? Ugh. They are just phoning in these threats, I am very disappointed.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if they are connected with the enemy ships
entries.context: Skippy translating the Maxolhx threats with editorial commentary on the quality of their threatening

entries.skippy_text: Um, Joe. They are opening missile launch doors.
entries.trigger: Joe antagonizing the Maxolhx commander with insults
entries.context: Skippy nervously warning Joe that his approach is provoking a weapons response

entries.skippy_text: Um, Joe. I think he may be calling your bluff.
entries.trigger: Joe confronting the Maxolhx commander after deploying Elder weapons
entries.context: Skippy nervously warning that the Maxolhx commander may have figured out Joe's bluff

entries.skippy_text: Wow. Pissed-off Skippy is not a 'he' doing the gossiping. I mean, I occasionally will join in, to correct the facts.
entries.trigger: Various crew interactions
entries.context: Additional Skippy commentary about gossip and his role in it

entries.skippy_text: Wow. While I am pissed at you for not telling me upfront, I guess I have to thank you for considering my feelings. Even though you were completely incompetent about it.
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy that he and Simms were talking about Skippy's potential time bomb
entries.context: Skippy processing the revelation that Joe had been protecting his feelings regarding the time bomb concern

entries.skippy_text: Do better, Joe. We can talk about that later. Right now, I need to think about what you said. Shit. The only way to know is for me to ask the wormhole network exactly what instructions I gave to it.
entries.trigger: Joe saying he's doing the best he can in handling the time bomb revelation
entries.context: Skippy identifying a path forward to investigate whether his subconscious betrayed them

entries.skippy_text: While it is possible that a subconscious part of me gave the wrong instructions to the network, I doubt that could have happened. The protocol I used required the network to repeat my instructions back to me, so I could verify it understood what I wanted. Why did I do that? Because I don't trust the stupid thing. The problem is, I didn't distrust it enough.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if there's any good news about the time bomb concern
entries.context: Skippy providing his analysis of why it's unlikely his subconscious betrayed them

entries.skippy_text: Well, ping her, knucklehead. Do I have to do everything around here?
entries.trigger: Joe asking for Skippy's help contacting Simms
entries.context: Skippy reacting with exasperation to being asked to do a simple communication task

entries.skippy_text: Um, this is more than a little odd, Joe.
entries.trigger: Joe saying he wants to talk with Simms privately without Skippy listening
entries.context: Skippy questioning why Joe would want a private conversation with Simms

entries.skippy_text: No way. You two have fun. Just don't get eaten by a bear.
entries.trigger: Joe reminding Skippy that Simms would know if Skippy insisted on listening
entries.context: Skippy agreeing to give Joe and Simms privacy and making a joke about bears

entries.skippy_text: Me? Why didn't you-
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy that he and Simms were talking about him
entries.context: Skippy's surprised reaction to learning the private conversation was about him

entries.skippy_text: Wowza. I can't argue with that logic. Joe?
entries.trigger: Simms pointing out that Skippy's subconscious didn't trigger the Elder weapons
entries.context: Skippy accepting Simms's evidence that the time bomb concern may be resolved

entries.skippy_text: OK, OK. Jeez, maybe I'll get lucky and there is a time bomb inside me. You two go do, whatever it is monkeys do, and we will-
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy he must confess the full Rikers story to everyone including Adams
entries.context: Skippy darkly joking that he'd rather have a time bomb than face Margaret Adams's reaction

entries.skippy_text: Sure, Joe. If you have an Elder Prime account? That will do. What is your last question?
entries.trigger: Joe asking how to get access to the Elder weapons
entries.context: Skippy continuing the Amazon Prime joke about Elder weapons delivery

entries.skippy_text: I dunno. You want only me to know where the weapons are? In that case, the weapons must be flown autonomously, I will need to program in the guidance before we jump. Otherwise, Bilby will know where they are.
entries.trigger: Simms asking if Skippy can hide the Elder weapons in the solar system
entries.context: Skippy working out the logistics of hiding the Elder weapons from all crew including Bilby

entries.skippy_text: No, except we had planned to jump directly out to Backstop, and now you need to tell the pilots not to select that jump option. The correct option is now 'Hotel'. Begins with the letter 'H', as in, 'Holy shit I cannot believe we are doing this'.
entries.trigger: Joe asking Skippy if there is anything he needs
entries.context: Skippy providing navigation instructions with a signature editorial comment about their plan

entries.skippy_text: Me neither, Skippy. Me neither.
entries.trigger: Joe responding to Skippy's comment about not believing they're doing this
entries.context: Joe echoing Skippy's disbelief at their own audacity - actually Joe's line, not Skippy's

entries.skippy_text: You didn't say it right, Joe.
entries.trigger: Skippy's avatar not appearing after Joe's introduction
entries.context: Skippy refusing to make his grand entrance because Joe didn't say the introduction correctly

entries.skippy_text: No. Ugh, why did I expect a filthy monkey to- Fine. Make it one aria, and one crowd-pleasing tune from my upcoming Broadway smash musical.
entries.trigger: Joe apologizing and offering to listen to an aria as apology
entries.context: Skippy negotiating the terms of his performance before agreeing to make his entrance to the Mavericks

entries.skippy_text: BEHOLD! Tis, I, Skippy the Magnificent!
entries.trigger: Skippy finally being convinced to make his grand entrance to the Mavericks
entries.context: Skippy's dramatic grand entrance to meet the Mavericks for the first time

entries.skippy_text: I am not a cartoon, you ignorant cretin. I am far beyond the poor understanding of-
entries.trigger: Dave calling Skippy 'Emby the cartoon'
entries.context: Skippy reacting with outrage to being called a cartoon by the Mavericks

entries.skippy_text: You monkeys are not giving me the proper respect!
entries.trigger: Jesse comparing Skippy's uniform to a Chuck E. Cheese mascot
entries.context: Skippy outraged that the Mavericks are not treating him with appropriate awe

entries.skippy_text: You also promised I could give the Mavericks a summary of our actions in the form of an epic opera, which-
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy to slow down and not frighten the Mavericks
entries.context: Skippy reminding Joe of his promised opera performance for the new guests

entries.skippy_text: Most of the time. He is also, I hate to say it, my friend.
entries.trigger: Joe admitting Skippy is an asshole but also his friend
entries.context: Skippy responding with a qualified agreement to Joe calling him a friend to the Mavericks

entries.skippy_text: In that case, I am very pleased to meet you, Staff Sergeant Colter. Indeed, I am honored to meet the Mavericks. We have been following your exploits, through your reports, and, well, any other information source I could hack into. I must say, we are terribly sorry that we were not able to help you on Camp Alpha.
entries.trigger: Jesse saying any friend of Joe's is a friend of his while eyeing Skippy suspiciously
entries.context: Skippy making a gracious introduction to the Mavericks, unusual for him

entries.skippy_text: According to UNEF Command, they are still being held on South Georgia island, in the South Atlantic ocean. They-
entries.trigger: Joe asking about the Kristang Keepers who were captured
entries.context: Skippy providing an update on the captured Kristang before being interrupted by Perkins's laughter

entries.skippy_text: You should have considered that when you flew off to be the big hero.
entries.trigger: Skippy moaning about having to tell everyone including Adams the full story
entries.context: Joe reminding Skippy that his actions at Rikers have consequences he must own

entries.skippy_text: Hmmph. I thought you'd be taller.
entries.trigger: Nert the Ruhar cadet being introduced to Skippy
entries.context: Skippy's typically rude opening comment to the Ruhar cadet

entries.skippy_text: That type of facility is called a 'brewery', and the planet's correct name is either 'Gehtanu' or 'Paradise'. You are welcome. It is my pleasure, no, my duty, to help flawed biological beings achieve better utilization of their limited intellect.
entries.trigger: Jates mentioning Dave's beer factory on Pradassis
entries.context: Skippy correcting Jates's terminology while claiming it as his duty to educate inferiors

entries.skippy_text: I am not a mere vessel for mildly alcoholic beverages. I am an Elder AI. Although the term 'artificial' is itself only an artificial construct.
entries.trigger: Jates's observation about Skippy being a beer can
entries.context: Skippy defending his identity and nature to Jates

entries.skippy_text: Yes. I know, you are awed by being in my presence. Do not feel that you are especially unworthy, all biologicals have the same reaction to my awesomeness.
entries.trigger: Jates's clear surprise at learning Skippy is an Elder AI
entries.context: Skippy interpreting Jates's surprise as awe and condescending about it

entries.skippy_text: Um, I, uh, what? Um, well, that is not exactly, um- Joe, tell him!
entries.trigger: Jates declaring that the current galactic situation is Skippy's fault because the Elders abandoned their responsibilities
entries.context: Skippy flustered and unable to respond to Jates's accusation about Elder irresponsibility

entries.skippy_text: But, but, you know nothing about me. I am a supremely-
entries.trigger: Joe agreeing with Jates that the Elders were irresponsible
entries.context: Skippy unable to complete his defense as both Joe and Jates gang up on him about Elder responsibility

entries.skippy_text: Hey! This is not, um, er, you are here to be awed by me! To experience wonderment, to bask in my glory.
entries.trigger: Jates calling the Elders and their trinkets supremely irresponsible
entries.context: Skippy trying to redirect the meeting back to his planned ego-stroking session

entries.skippy_text: TOASTER? I am not going to stand for being insulted by a big, scaly, stinky lizard!
entries.trigger: Jates calling Skippy a pathetic overgrown toaster
entries.context: Skippy reacting with outrage to being called a toaster by the Verd-kris surgun

entries.skippy_text: HEY! What are you doing? Don't touch me! Joe, he can't touch me!
entries.trigger: Jates physically picking up Skippy's canister and threatening to open it
entries.context: Skippy panicking as Jates physically handles his canister

entries.skippy_text: You put me down right this instant! I demand-
entries.trigger: Jates asking how the canister lid comes off
entries.context: Skippy demanding to be put down as Jates threatens to open his canister

entries.skippy_text: Hey! Hey! Joe, get him off of me!
entries.trigger: Jates threatening to defecate in Skippy's canister
entries.context: Skippy's desperate appeal to Joe as Jates threatens the ultimate insult to his canister

entries.skippy_text: You should have considered that when you flew off to be the big hero. You should have said 'Joe, I didn't actually think through how to tell people I abandoned them'. But no.
entries.trigger: Joe telling Skippy he brought the consequences on himself
entries.context: Skippy acknowledging his past mistake with lingering bitterness

entries.skippy_text: You should have told me what I was in for. Maybe I should have thought about that before flying off on my own.
entries.trigger: Joe continuing to point out Skippy's responsibility
entries.context: Skippy showing genuine self-reflection about his decision to abandon the crew at Rikers

entries.skippy_text: Joe, should he skip the opera? Is the opera really necessary?
entries.trigger: Jesse hearing that Skippy wants to perform an opera for the Mavericks
entries.context: Skippy unexpectedly asking Joe if the opera is really needed, showing awareness of the Mavericks' reluctance

entries.skippy_text: Skippy thinks that monkeys love bananas, like I said, it is a long story.
entries.trigger: Perkins asking why banana-flavored sludges
entries.context: Joe explaining Skippy's monkey/banana assumption - this is actually Joe's line explaining Skippy's behavior

entries.skippy_text: I am all about giving to others. Plan B, then. I will help you with the DJ duties. You? OK, you be the front man, but, seriously, you need help.
entries.trigger: Skippy's broader pattern of claiming he's generous while being self-serving
entries.context: Skippy's general assertion of generosity combined with the DJ offer
